action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed, a wardrobe and a pillow. The wardrobe is closed. The pillow is on the bed. There is a passage to a living room here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'move' action.
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.
> go through passage to living room
I don't know what you mean.
> walk through passage to living room
I don't know how to interpret this 'walk' action.
> go through passage to living room
I don't know what you mean.
> proceed through passage to living room
I don't know how to interpret this 'proceed' action.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a shelf, a chair, a side table, a book and a table. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a bedroom and a kitchen here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'move' action.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book and a pillow.
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know how to interpret this 'walk' action.
I don't know what you mean.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a counter and a plate. The cupboard is closed. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'move' action.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
You can't see a table here.
> go through passage to living room
I don't know what you mean.
> walk through passage to living room
I don't know how to interpret this 'walk' action.
> go through passage to living room
I don't know what you mean.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a shelf, a chair, a side table and a table. There are passages to a bedroom and a kitchen here.
You put the pillow on the table.
You put the book on the table.
You can't see a plate here.
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know how to interpret this 'walk' action.
I don't know what you mean.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a counter and a plate. The cupboard is closed. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'move' action.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
> go through passage to living room
I don't know what you mean.
> walk through passage to living room
I don't know how to interpret this 'walk' action.
> go through passage to living room
I don't know what you mean.

You are in a living room now. There are a pillow, a couch, a shelf, a chair, a side table, a book and a table. The pillow is on the table. The book is on the table. There are passages to a bedroom and a kitchen here.
